meanings.sent1: She always acts so uppity around us, thinking she's better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: The uppity cat refused to play with the other pets, believing itself to be superior.
meanings.sent3: The uppity squirrel demanded only the finest nuts, as if it were royalty.
meanings.sent4: Her uppity attitude towered over the room like a dark cloud, casting a shadow on everyone.
meanings.sent5: The uppity peacock strutted around, flaunting its colorful feathers for all to see.

meanings.definition: Acting as if superior to others
meanings.sent1: He gave me an uppity look, as if I was beneath his notice.
meanings.sent2: The uppity student refused to work with his classmates, believing himself to be better.
meanings.sent3: The uppity toddler insisted on being carried everywhere, like a tiny emperor.
meanings.sent4: Her uppity behavior soared above the rest, isolating her from the group.
meanings.sent5: The uppity rooster crowed loudly, asserting its dominance over the farmyard.

meanings.sent1: She made an uppity assumption about her chances of winning the competition.
meanings.sent2: The uppity driver cut off other cars on the road, sure of his own skills.
meanings.sent3: The uppity chef declared his dish the best in the world, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: His uppity behavior in the meeting made him a target for criticism.
meanings.sent5: The uppity actor believed he was destined for stardom, despite his lack of experience.
